spectrometer_mass.a.documentation: Array of atomic masses for which partial pressures are recorded by the spectrometer

spectrometer_mass.a_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "a"

spectrometer_mass.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

spectrometer_mass.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

spectrometer_mass.code.library[:].parame.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_mass.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

spectrometer_mass.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.creatio.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.homogen.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.occurre.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.provena.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documentatiing provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.provide.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

spectrometer_mass.ids_properties.version.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

spectrometer_mass.latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.

spectrometer_mass.latency_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "latency"

spectrometer_mass.pressures_partial.documentation: Partial pressures recorded by the spectrometer

spectrometer_mass.pressures_partial.data.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

spectrometer_mass.pressures_partial.vali.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)
